intro: Palicourea cardiomorpha subsp. perpusilla, commonly known as the small heartleaf palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
